title: Job 27:1
text: MOREOVER Job continued his parable, and said,

title: Job 27:2
text: As God liveth, who hath taken away my judgment; and the Almighty, who hath vexed my soul;

title: Job 27:3
text: All the while my breath is in me, and the spirit of God is in my nostrils;

title: Job 27:4
text: My lips shall not speak wickedness, nor my tongue utter deceit.

title: Job 27:5
text: God forbid that I should justify you: till I die I will not remove mine integrity from me.

title: Job 27:6
text: My righteousness I hold fast, and will not let it go: my heart shall not reproach me so long as I live.

title: Job 27:7
text: Let mine enemy be as the wicked, and he that riseth up against me as the unrighteous.

title: Job 27:8
text: For what is the hope of the hypocrite, though he hath gained, when God taketh away his soul?

title: Job 27:9
text: Will God hear his cry when trouble cometh upon him?

title: Job 27:10
text: Will he delight himself in the Almighty?  will he always call upon God?

title: Job 27:11
text: I will teach you by the hand of God: that which is with the Almighty will I not conceal.

title: Job 27:12
text: Behold, all ye yourselves have seen it; why then are ye thus altogether vain?

title: Job 27:13
text: This is the portion of a wicked man with God, and the heritage of oppressors, which they shall receive of the Almighty.

title: Job 27:14
text: If his children be multiplied, it is for the sword: and his offspring shall not be satisfied with bread.

title: Job 27:15
text: Those that remain of him shall be buried in death: and his widows shall not weep.

title: Job 27:16
text: Though he heap up silver as the dust, and prepare raiment as the clay;

title: Job 27:17
text: He may prepare it, but the just shall put it on, and the innocent shall divide the silver.

title: Job 27:18
text: He buildeth his house as a moth, and as a booth that the keeper maketh.

title: Job 27:19
text: The rich man shall lie down, but he shall not be gathered: he openeth his eyes, and he is not.

title: Job 27:20
text: Terrors take hold on him as waters, a tempest stealeth him away in the night.

title: Job 27:21
text: The east wind carrieth him away, and he departeth: and as a storm hurleth him out of his place.

title: Job 27:22
text: For God shall cast upon him, and not spare: he would fain flee out of his hand.

title: Job 27:23
text: Men shall clap their hands at him, and shall hiss him out of his place.
